item.title: 2020 SUPER GT Rd.1 Okayama Tournament Postponed!
item.dc:creator: Spookie
item.description:
The 2020 AUTOBACS SUPER GT Round1 Takanoko Hotel OKAYAMA GT 300km race scheduled to take place on April 11 through April 12, 2020, has been officially suspended. According to an official statement by Okayama International Circuit Co., Ltd. and GT Association Co., Ltd., both companies have unanimously stated that, “In light of the (Japanese) government’s …

The post 2020 SUPER GT Rd.1 Okayama Tournament Postponed! appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
The 2020 AUTOBACS SUPER GT Round1 Takanoko Hotel OKAYAMA GT 300km race scheduled to take place on April 11 through April 12, 2020, has been officially suspended.

According to an official statement by Okayama International Circuit Co., Ltd. and GT Association Co., Ltd., both companies have unanimously stated that, “In light of the (Japanese) government’s decision on stopping the corona-virus infection and the disease’s fast spread, we have decided to postpone the event by taking into account the health and safety of visitors and competitors.”

For those that don’t know, the relation between SUPER GT with Hatsune Miku is their GT Project that is the concept of a “racing team run by fans”. First launched in 2008 by GOODSMILE RACING, the project has since been participating in the SUPER GT GT300 class series, the greatest motorsport race in Japan. Its trademark is a machine with a Hatsune Miku Racing Ver. design.

The schedule of the postponed tournament will be announced at a later date. Details on ticket refunds will be provided on the Okayama International Circuit official website.

Links

Okayama International Circuit Official Homepage

The post 2020 SUPER GT Rd.1 Okayama Tournament Postponed! appeared first on VNN.

item.title: Hatsune Miku “GT Project Racing Miku 2019 Cheer Ver. ” Goodies Available!

The guys at AQUAMARINE have unveiled two new products today of Hatsune Miku in her GT Project Racing 2019 Cheer Ver and they’re looking really good! ✨2月発売商品✨ 初音ミク GTプロジェクトレーシングミク 2019 チアVer. 🌟ICカードケース🌟手帳型スマホケース 全国の店舗様にて発売予定！#初音ミク #レーシングミク #fightgsr pic.twitter.com/viATo4nQ11 — アクアマリン (@aquamarine_fig) February 17, 2020 These goodies have been carefully designed to represent our beloved turquoise twintailed Miku …

The post Hatsune Miku “GT Project Racing Miku 2019 Cheer Ver. ” Goodies Available! appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
The guys at AQUAMARINE have unveiled two new products today of Hatsune Miku in her GT Project Racing 2019 Cheer Ver and they’re looking really good!

2月発売商品

初音ミク GTプロジェクト
レーシングミク 2019 チアVer.

ICカードケース
手帳型スマホケース

全国の店舗様にて発売予定！#初音ミク #レーシングミク #fightgsr pic.twitter.com/viATo4nQ11

— アクアマリン (@aquamarine_fig) February 17, 2020

These goodies have been carefully designed to represent our beloved turquoise twintailed Miku in a cheerleader-like outfit and pompoms.

Available this month are:

  • A card case for any purpose with a Racing Miku design.
  • A smartphone case of Racing Miku.

Talking about price, you can purchase the smartphone case for a whopping 4,000 yen (excluding tax) and the card case for 2,000 yen (excluding tax) from the Aquamarine Shop!

Sources

Aquamarine Figures on Twitter

The post Hatsune Miku “GT Project Racing Miku 2019 Cheer Ver. ” Goodies Available! appeared first on VNN.

item.title: Hatsune Miku x Yomiuri Land Go-Kart Collab Has Been Announced!
item.dc:creator: Spookie
item.description:
A brand new attraction has been unveiled by the wonderful people of GOODSMILE RACING as a collaboration between Hatsune Miku and Yomiuri Land has been announced with a date already set in stone. From February 15 to March 15, 2020 you will be able to take yourself to the pit via go-kart racing! This collaboration includes …

The post Hatsune Miku x Yomiuri Land Go-Kart Collab Has Been Announced! appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
A brand new attraction has been unveiled by the wonderful people of GOODSMILE RACING as a collaboration between Hatsune Miku and Yomiuri Land has been announced with a date already set in stone.

From February 15 to March 15, 2020 you will be able to take yourself to the pit via go-kart racing!

This collaboration includes many cool things and to give it a wonderful theme, DECO*27’s “Positive Parade” has been declared as the official the event song! (Listen Here)

Fountain Show, Sea Lions and Exhibition Hall Hatsune Miku Ver.

The illustration for “Positive Parade” will be projected onto the water whilst the song plays for the show. The lights will be coloured in iconic Miku colours during the show. There will also be an exhibition for all attendees to see where illustrations, songs and images of Hatsune Miku and related events will be displayed in its own exhibition space within the venue.

Also, sea lions will perform to Hatsune Miku music with the highlight of this show will be about them dancing to DECO*27’s “Positive Parade”. The announcer for the event will also be in Miku cosplay.

Collaboration Rides, Food & Goods

This all-new amazing collaboration includes a plethora of items, rides and provisions for fans to enjoy throughout the day after a hard yet fulfilling day of racing. For the rides, we have quite a select bunch of attractions for people to venture into and enjoy to the max, check them out below:

  • Bandit – The rollercoaster “Bandit” will have Miku decorations decorating the station building, and Miku herself will make departure announcements for the ride.
  • Giant Ferris Wheel – Pretty self explainative, music featuring Miku will play during the ride for fans to enjoy. All 6 Piapro characters will decorate the carriages beautifully.
  • Merry-Go-Round – There will be Miku decorations and Miku music playing during the ride.
  • Go-Kart Racing – The go-karts will be decorated with images of Racing Miku.
  • Looping Starship – There will be Miku decorations on the ride.
  • Bungee Jump – You get a special badge for being one of the courageous people tha dare to jump!

For our hungry fans, you’ll be pleased to know the prices for the food being sold at the show so check them out!

  • Hatsune Miku’s Leek Festival Ramen 2020 – 1250 yen
  • Hatsune Miku’s Rolled Leek – 800 yen
  • Hatsune Miku’s Warm Clam Chowder Bread Bowl – 750 yen
  • Hatsune Miku’s Tapioca Kiwi – 750 yen (single item), 1600yen (mini size with souvenir cup)
  • Hatsune Miku’s Mint Pancake Sandwich – 600 yen (single item), 1600yen (with souvenir cup)
  • Hatsune Miku’s Orange Pancake Sandwich – 600 yen (single item), 1600yen (with souvenir cup)
  • Hatsune Miku’s Lemon Pancake Sandwich – 600 yen (single item), 1600yen (with souvenir cup)
  • Hatsune Miku’s Popping Strawberry Milk – 650 yen (single item), 1600yen (mini size with souvenir cup)
  • MEIKO’s Tapioca Strawberry – 750 yen (single item), 1600yen (mini size with souvenir cup)
  • KAITO’s Tapioca Ramune Soda – 750 yen (single item), 1600yen (mini size with souvenir cup)
  • Hatsune Miku’s Colourful Mint Crepe – 800yen
  • Pineapple Soda (Miku’s Blue-Green, Rin’s Orange, Len’s Yellow, Luka’s Pink, MEIKO’s Red, KAITO’s Blue) – 700yen each

And for our amazing collectors that cannot wait to put their hands on some amazing merchandise of our beloved turquoise-twintailed vocaloid, the list of goods available for purchase at the venue:

  • Trading Acrylic Badge (6 types, Random) – 660 yen each
  • Large Can Badge (6 types) – 660yen each
  • Polaroid-Style Card Set – 660 yen
  • Acrylic Keychain (6 types, Random) – 1100 yen each
  • Clear File Set (Set of 4) – 1650 yen
  • B2 Tapestry – 3300 yen
  • T-Shirt (Size: S, M, L, XL) – 3850 yen
  • Hoodie (Size: S, M, L, XL) – 6600 yen
  • Crunchy Chocolate with Card (Flavors: Milk Chocolate, White, Strawberry) – 1080yen
  • Postcard Set (Set of 12) – 1320yen
  • Trading Acrylic Badge (6 types, Random) – 660 yen each
  • Large Can Badge (6 types) – 660 yen
  • Polaroid-Style Card Set – 660 yen
  • Acrylic Stand Keychain (6 types) – 990 yen each
  • Clear File Set (Set of 4) – 1650 yen
  • Tote Bag – 2750 yen
  • Neckwarmer (6 styles) – 2750 yen each
  • Gummy Box (2 Types (Muscat, Orange, Lemon / Peach, Apple, Cider) – 648yen each

Additionally, you’ll be able to make your own Miku + other Piapro characters keychain (3cm x 5cm) for only 500 yen.

Hatsune Miku Rally

At the venue, you’ll be able to visit 7 locations around the amusement park where there will be photo panels where you’ll use your phone to scan a QR code and that way you can collect stamps. If you’re one of the lucky ones, you will hit ‘bingo’ and obtain a prize! But if you don’t win right away then don’t be sad because there’s still a prize for participating. The rewards are:

  • Bingo Reward: Event-Limited Can Badge (6 types, Random)
  • Participation Reward: Original Sticker

This collaboration looks more and more amazing the further you read about it! How excited are you to visit Yomiuri Land and race your friends in these cool Miku go-karts? Let us know in the comments below!

Sources

GoodSmile Racing on Twitter

The post Hatsune Miku x Yomiuri Land Go-Kart Collab Has Been Announced! appeared first on VNN.

item.title: Brand New Hatsune Miku Figmas Have Been Unveiled!
item.dc:creator: Spookie
item.description:
From the geniuses at Max Factory and Good Smile Company comes an announcement that surely will lighten up the hearts of all Hatsune Miku fans – now that two figma figures have been unveiled featuring the worldwide popular, turquoise-twintailed Vocaloid. Hatsune Miku’s New Figmas! The first figma to be unveiled was the “Racing Miku Ver. …

The post Brand New Hatsune Miku Figmas Have Been Unveiled! appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
From the geniuses at Max Factory and Good Smile Company comes an announcement that surely will lighten up the hearts of all Hatsune Miku fans – now that two figma figures have been unveiled featuring the worldwide popular, turquoise-twintailed Vocaloid.

Hatsune Miku’s New Figmas!

The first figma to be unveiled was the “Racing Miku Ver. 2020″ from “Hatsune Miku GT Project” in a prototype form. As you can see, the details and coloring have yet to be determined, however Max Factory wanted to give us a small glimpse as of what’s to come for this version of Hatsune Miku. You can appreciate every single small detail put into the figure. We’re very excited to see how the final product is going to look like!

And last but not least is the all new cute “Sakura Miku” in a very spring-like outfit, with small wonderful finishes and touches that gives the figma a special look. While not many details have been revealed so far about this upcoming figma we do know that this colored prototype will be premiered at the Wonder Festival in Tokyo.

Tell us how cute these new figmas are in the comments below!

Sources

Max Factory Official on Twitter

Good Smile Company US on Twitter

The post Brand New Hatsune Miku Figmas Have Been Unveiled! appeared first on VNN.

item.content:encoded:
In search of more LINE stickers to make your conversations more happy-going and friendly? Then look no more! Goodsmile Racing just released an official set featuring an adorable chibi Racing Miku 2019 as main character, and she’s absolutely perfect for such a role!

レーシングミク 2019Ver.のLINEスタンプが発売されました！ぜひぜひチェックをお願いいたします！ のこりの3戦でたくさん使ってくださいっ(み)https://t.co/B68PM9Cmr8

40 cutesy stickers, illustrated by Annindoufu, are waiting for you and your LINE messenger for only 1,99 USD, just click here and adopt her as your next emoji mascot!

It seems that those stickers might not be available in certain countries, so be aware you might be unable to buy this set!

Stay tuned with us on VNN and don’t forget to support Goodsmile Racing and their Hatsune Miku GT Project with us!

item.title: Goodsmile Racing Finishes 10th at the 10 Hours of Suzuka
item.dc:creator: mikufan.com
item.description:
The 48th edition of the of the Summer Endurance Race concluded last weekend with Audi Sport Team WRT taking victory at the 10 Hours of Suzuka. Just a lap behind them was Mercedes-AMG Team GOODSMILE finishing in 10th place. 📝 #Suzuka10H RACE REPORT Audi Sport Team WRT claimed victory in the penultimate round of 2019’s …

The post Goodsmile Racing Finishes 10th at the 10 Hours of Suzuka appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
The 48th edition of the of the Summer Endurance Race concluded last weekend with Audi Sport Team WRT taking victory at the 10 Hours of Suzuka. Just a lap behind them was Mercedes-AMG Team GOODSMILE finishing in 10th place.

#Suzuka10H RACE REPORT

Audi Sport Team WRT claimed victory in the penultimate round of 2019’s #IntGTC campaign at #Suzuka10H this evening thanks to a dominant performance by Van der Linde, Vanthoor and Vervisch.https://t.co/V4RDSVemzS pic.twitter.com/YbWUB26WVe

— Intercontinental GT Challenge (@IntercontGTC) August 25, 2019

The #00 Hatsune Miku Mercedes-AMG GT3 would qualify in 6th for the start of the race which started off well overtaking the #777 CarGuy Ferrari 488 GT3 on the first lap. The first hour of the race would be calm with some overtakes and minor spins until the first big incident would happen when the #88 JLOC Lamborghini Huracan GT3 made contact with the #5 GTNET Nissan GT-R GT3 to overtake spinning both cars and getting the #34 Walkenhorst BMW M6 GT3 that was in 2nd place involved forcing them to pit for repairs.

DRAMA AT THE FRONT! @C_Krognes's @Walkenhorst_MS BMW is tagged by GTNet's spinning Nissan and has damaged its rear wing!@augustofarfus just made it past and continues to lead, but @followWRT's Vervisch is now up to second with @goodsmileracing third.#IntGTC | @suzuka_event pic.twitter.com/kKL9J6wyov

— Intercontinental GT Challenge (@IntercontGTC) August 25, 2019

Things start to heat up after 2 hours into the race when the #27 HubAuto Ferrari 488 GT3 and the #98 Arrows Honda NSX GT3 started banging wheels until the Honda went off track followed by a ‘T-bone’ collision with the Ferrari bringing out the first long Full Course Yellow meaning all cars should slow down and no overtaking is allowed.

BIG IMPACT! @NickCassidy_'s HubAuto @FerrariRaces has been T-boned at the Hairpin by Arrows Racing's @hondaproracing. The two made contact at the kick, sending the NSX across the gravel.

Full Course Yellow #IntGTC | #Suzuka10H pic.twitter.com/llk12aig56

— Intercontinental GT Challenge (@IntercontGTC) August 25, 2019

After the race restarted the #999 GruppeM Mercedes-AMG GT3 makes a move on the #00 Miku AMG late braking into the final chicane causing both cars to go off track. This also helped the #018 KCMG Nissan GT-R GT3 (Not to be confused with the #18 UpGarage NSX GT3) overtake the Miku AMG down the main straight as she was recovering from the earlier contact. The incident gave the #999 GruppeM a 5 second penalty for cutting the chicane.

Change for P4: Marciello lunges down the inside of @goodsmileracing's AMG at the chicane and makes it stick. That causes @kamui_kobayashi to lose time and allows @KCMotorgroup's @aleximperatori to also nip through!#IntGTC | #Suzuka10H pic.twitter.com/bkquhcPcQn

— Intercontinental GT Challenge (@IntercontGTC) August 25, 2019

As the race enters the second half, the #27 HubAuto Ferrari loses control at the fast-left turn of 130R crashing into the foam barriers, bringing out the Full Course Yellow once again. Fortunately, Nick Cassidy who was driving the Ferrari escaped un-injured and surprisingly the car wasn’t badly damaged that he managed to drive it back into the pits for repairs.

More hits than elvis today. Hit by an AM I was lapping and paid for it later. Can’t wait to get back to Super Formula and Super GT. pic.twitter.com/i8cz3C6lsk

— Nick Cassidy (@NickCassidy_) August 25, 2019

As night falls at the track, the lights go on giving teams an extra challenge racing in the darkness. As the race was reaching it’s closing stages, Super GT’s GT500 driver Tsugio Matsuda in the #35 KCMG GT-R makes a move on the #107 Bentley Team M-Sport late braking into the final chicane and still fighting for 6th place side-by-side along the main straight until the GT-R successfully overtook the Bentley.

It's Godzilla vs Thunder at @suzuka_event!

Well played @TsugioMatsuda and @jordanpepper46! Fantastic battle.#IntGTC | #Suzuka10H pic.twitter.com/G6rDesFWQU

— Intercontinental GT Challenge (@IntercontGTC) August 25, 2019

At last after a long 10 hours of non-stop racing the checkered flag was waved with the #25 Audi Sport Team WRT taking victory with the #00 Miku AMG just behind them a lap behind to finish in 10th position. Although Mercedes-AMG Team GOODSMILE may not have won the race overall. The team has been awarded the “Team of the Day” as voted by race fans during the race. They were also awarded the winner of the Super GT award and runner up of the Asia Award for being the first Super GT team to finish and a team with at least 2 or more Asian drivers respectively.

00号車GOODSMILE RACINGはアジア賞2位 SUPER GT賞1位
おめでとう&お疲れ様でした#SUZUKA10H #fightgsr pic.twitter.com/oD3sDq87MR

— oChii XS Max (@hiroya_0124) August 25, 2019

Congratulations to all the winners and the teams that finished on the podium. Until then, Super GT is next on the 7th and 8th of September at Autopolis.

Source: Mikufan.com

The post Goodsmile Racing Finishes 10th at the 10 Hours of Suzuka appeared first on VNN.

item.title: In Full Speed With More Racing Miku Merchandise!
item.dc:creator: Spookie
item.description:
No matter in what period of the year we are in, it’s always time for more Racing Miku merchandise! Isn’t it? COCOLLABO Brings us an Acrylic Stand and a Parka! Let’s begin with COCOLLABO‘s new items themed after our current Hatsune Miku GT Project mascot from Goodsmile Racing: Racing Miku 2019! Today, they have added …

The post In Full Speed With More Racing Miku Merchandise! appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
No matter in what period of the year we are in, it’s always time for more Racing Miku merchandise! Isn’t it?

COCOLLABO Brings us an Acrylic Stand and a Parka!

Let’s begin with COCOLLABO‘s new items themed after our current Hatsune Miku GT Project mascot from Goodsmile Racing: Racing Miku 2019! Today, they have added two new different items to their online shop, a big acrylic stand and a comfy parka! Check them out below!

Racing Miku 2019 Thailand Ver. Big Acrylic Stand

This marvelous acrylic stands is bigger than average. It is about 200mm of height and features our beloved Racing Miku 2019 in her Thailand support attire!

Size is W230xH200xD5mm, with the base having a diameter of 130mm! Its price is 3,240 JPY and will be released on early September!

Want to pre-order this item? Then click here to reach its product page!

Racing Miku 209 Full Graphic Parka

Nothing shows your support for a team more than wearing their mascot everyday, isn’t it? I bet this Racing Miku 2019 Full Graphic Parka will look great in your wardrobe then!

Available in three different sizes (M/L/XL) and being made in polyester, this Parka sure doesn’t fail in showing Racing Miku 2019’s charm and enthusiasm!

It is priced 9,720 JPY and will be delivered on early September, just like the previous item!

You can pre-order it by clicking here!

POP UP PARADE Racing Miku 2010 Now up for Pre-order!

Next we have the much awaited POP UP PARADE figure of Racing Miku 2010 from Good Smile Company! It will finally be available for pre-order through their online store!

Miku from the 2010 Hatsune Miku GT Project!

“The fifth figure in the POP UP PARADE series is Racing Miku 2010 Ver. from the 2010 Racing Miku GT Project! Illustrator redjuice‘s mechanic style design has been faithfully recreated, including Miku’s unique heels, her tools and her adorable smile. The figure has been painted to accurately reflect the different textures each material, making for a truly stunning appearance.”

She’s approximately 170mm in height and is priced 3,900 JPY, a real deal for fans in search for high quality figures at an affordable price!

You can find and pre-order her here until July 11th at 12PM (JST)! She’s scheduled for release on October 2019!

Hatsune Miku GT Project Exhibition Period Extended!

Last but not least, we have some great news for fans that are currently in Japan: Hatsune Miku GT Project’s exhibition period got extended to June 22nd!

《初音ミク GTプロジェクト展 》ではオンラインショップの人気商品を直接手に取ってお買い求め頂けます。本日バスタオル【黒】も再入荷致しました！遠方の方はオンラインショップへどうぞ♪
期間 6/22(土)まで会期延長
平日 15:00-19:00
土日 11:00-19:00
場所 アキバCOギャラリー pic.twitter.com/AzxiLrB6cD

— チーム右京オンラインショップ (@teamukyo_shop) June 13, 2019

Location is Akiba CO Gallery. It’s open on weekdays on 3PM until 7PM, and on 11AM to 7PM during weekends!

This is your chance to grab some merchandise!

Sources

Stay tuned with us on VNN and don’t forget to support Goodsmile Racing and their Hatsune Miku GT Project with us!

Hatsune Miku is on Facebook (English and Japanese), Twitter (English and Japanese), Youtube and Weibo
Don’t forget to check Good Smile Company’s POP UP PARADE product line up page as well!
COCOLLABO is on Twitter as well, and has an official website featuring an entire category filled with Racing Miku 2019 merchandise!

The post In Full Speed With More Racing Miku Merchandise! appeared first on VNN.

item.title: Snow Miku 2020 Design Finalists Announced, Voting Website Launched & Livestream Summary
item.dc:creator: Spookie
item.description:
Good Smile Company’s “Snow Miku Time” livestream event has finished, and has a lot of exciting news to share! If you missed the live stream event, you can rewatch the YouTube recording for as long as it’s available. Let’s get started on the announcements! Even though it was the last part of the live stream, the reveal …

The post Snow Miku 2020 Design Finalists Announced, Voting Website Launched & Livestream Summary appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
Good Smile Company’s “Snow Miku Time” livestream event has finished, and has a lot of exciting news to share! If you missed the live stream event, you can rewatch the YouTube recording for as long as it’s available. Let’s get started on the announcements!

Even though it was the last part of the live stream, the reveal of the Snow Miku and Yukine 2020 design finalists is what everyone was waiting for! Here’s the list of the 6 finalists:

#1: “Grand Piano” by 杏夏蜜柑 → https://piapro.jp/t/saxQ
#2: “Taiko” by こり → https://piapro.jp/t/YxrR
#3: “Horn” by メープル → https://piapro.jp/t/HnGM
#4: “Accordion” by mgr → https://piapro.jp/t/sWBP
#5: “Flute” by 二六時中 → https://piapro.jp/t/lO2m
#6: “Marching Band” by ππ → https://piapro.jp/t/P9Kf

Community voting will be counted until May 17th, JST. Only one vote per person/device will be counted! The winning design will be announced at Magical Mirai 2019.

-> CLICK HERE TO VOTE! <-
Magical Mirai 2019

A new piece of artwork showing off Magical Mirai 2019 themed outfits for Kagamine Rin & Len, Megurine Luka, KAITO and MEIKO were revealed during the livestream. Expect these designs to play part in decorations and goods for Magical Mirai 2019!

The Nendoroid Hatsune Miku: Magical Mirai 2018 ver. was also announced during the stream! Details regarding pricing and release date were not yet announced, but we can expect to hear more soon.

Racing Miku 2019

Good Smile Company announced a 1/8 scale figure for Racing Miku 2018, based on the art design by Annin Oiko! There’s only a prototype sculpture being teased for now. Expect a painted version to be revealed, along with pricing and release info at a later date.

Good Smile Racing and Nitroplus are collaborating together again this year with Racing Miku and Super Sonico. Two new artworks by Minoa and 津路参汰 were released as part of this collaboration. Other details of the collaboration will come at a later time.

Other Goods & Collabs

A scale figure of Hatsune Miku Symphony 2018~2019 will be made! The figure will be based on the original artwork by Rella. Other details are not yet available, so keep watching for that.

Also, a Hatsune Miku x Macaron collaboration was announced, which will make special Cryptonloid themed Macaroons available, along with an A2 size visual poster!

Lastly, SEGA announced the availability and release dates for the following prize plushies and figures: Hatsune Miku: White Dress ver. plushie (releases 3rd week of May 2019), Hatsune Miku: White Dress ver. premium figure (releases 4th week of May 2019), a new trio of Hatsune Miku keychain plushies (releases 3rd week of June 2019) and Mega Jumbo Fuwafuwa ver. Sakura Miku plushie (on preorder at Chara-Ani until May 28th).

Source: Mikufan.com

The post Snow Miku 2020 Design Finalists Announced, Voting Website Launched & Livestream Summary appeared first on VNN.

item.title: FREEing’s Racing Miku 2017 Thailand Ver. Figure up for Pre-order Starting From May 8th!
item.dc:creator: Spookie
item.description:
What could make our month of May better than Racing Miku 2017 Thailand Version’s figure being up for pre-order very soon? Yes, our favorite racing fairy makes a comeback once again giving us a spark of tropical atmosphere! Let’s give her a look together! A Tanned Beauty for Your Needs! Probably one of the most …

The post FREEing’s Racing Miku 2017 Thailand Ver. Figure up for Pre-order Starting From May 8th! appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
What could make our month of May better than Racing Miku 2017 Thailand Version’s figure being up for pre-order very soon? Yes, our favorite racing fairy makes a comeback once again giving us a spark of tropical atmosphere! Let’s give her a look together!

A Tanned Beauty for Your Needs!

Probably one of the most popular and loved versions of Racing Miku was the one designed by Tony Taka back in 2017. This fairy Miku used to cheer for GSR’s team flawlessly and, as you might remember, she also had a Thailand version, which is now going to become a marvelous 1/1 scale figure to be released on November!

With such a tropical feeling accompanied by her gentle pose and her sophisticate tanned skin, this Racing Miku will be perfect to give some fresh air to your collection her hair also use a special clear-like type of parts, giving them an even more soft coloration. There is no way you would miss this release!

This figure’s prototype was made by Design COCO and will be priced 17,000 JPY (tax excluded). She will be up for pre-order via Good Smile Company’s online store starting from tomorrow until June 6th, so you might want to be fast if you want to grab her!  Fairies can easily escape from humans after all, right?

Sources

While we wait for this awesome figure to be released and please our collectors’ heart content, we can admire her from the photos that GSR shared with us via their official blog!

Don’t forget to stay tuned with us on VNN for all the news about your favorite Virtual Singers!

Goodsmile Racing on Facebook and Twitter (Japanese only)
FREEing on Twitter
Goodsmile Racing Official Blog Post

The post FREEing’s Racing Miku 2017 Thailand Ver. Figure up for Pre-order Starting From May 8th! appeared first on VNN.

item.content:encoded:
During last night’s news stream by Goodsmile Racing, the design for this year’s Thailand Cheer version of Racing Miku 2019 was announced! The design by @Annin_Oiko features Racing Miku with the usual tanned look, along with a sailor-outfit inspired 2 piece bikini and umbrella. She’s absolutely cute!

This design will be featured in upcoming merchandise, as well as at this year’s Round 4 race in Thailand for the SUPER GT 2019 competition. A figure is also likely to be announced sometime later, so stay tuned for those updates!

Trivia: Thailand version Racing Miku has been a reoccurring idea since the first design in 2014.

Source: Mikufan.com

The post Racing Miku 2019: Thailand Cheer ver. Design Revealed appeared first on VNN.
